CRITER_DESCR: Implementation of adaptation solutions
Assessment of adaptation solutions that can reduce the identified physical climate risk
Where applicable, the solution complies with the do no significant harm technical screening criteria for that activity.

For existing activities and new activities using existing physical assets, the economic operator implements physical and non-physical solutions (‘adaptation solutions’), over a period of time of up to five years, that reduce the most important identified physical climate risks that are material to that activity. An adaptation plan for the implementation of those solutions is drawn up accordingly.
CRITER_SHORT_DESCR: Existing activities - Physical and non-physical solutions

CRITER_DESCR: The adaptation solutions implemented are monitored and measured against pre-defined indicators and remedial action is considered where those indicators are not met
The adaptation solutions implemented favour nature-based solutions or rely on blue or green infrastructure to the extent possible

For new activities and existing activities using newly-built physical assets, the economic operator integrates the adaptation solutions that reduce the most important identified physical climate risks that are material to that activity at the time of design and construction and has implemented them before the start of operations.
CRITER_SHORT_DESCR: New activities - Physical and non-physical solutions

CRITER_DESCR: The adaptation solutions implemented do not adversely affect the adaptation efforts or the level of resilience to physical climate risks
The adaptation solutions implemented are consistent with local, sectoral, regional or national adaptation plans and strategies
Aluminium Manufacturing - Primary Aluminium
Aluminium Manufacturing - Secondary Aluminium
EIA (Environmental Impact Assessment) (Directive 2011/92/EU)
Location in or near biodiversity-sensitive areas
Circular economy
Carbon Intensity for Indirect GHG Emissions
The climate projections and assessment of impacts are based on best practice and available guidance
The assessment is performed using the highest available resolution
For activities with an expected lifespan of less than 10 years, the assessment is performed, at least by using climate projections at the smallest appropriate scale

Assessment of adaptation solutions that can reduce the identified physical climate risk
Climate risk and vulnerability assessment to assess the materiality of the physical climate risks on the economic activity
Screening of the activity to identify which physical climate risks may affect the performance of the economic activity during its expected lifetime
